industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Job Summary

J

Position: Air Import Manager

A well-established multi billlion dollar transportation/logistics provider has an opportunity an Air Import Operations Manager. This role will oversee all facets of Import Operations for a global base of clients importing to the U.S. Great opportunity for a candidate with international freight forwarding skills to join a dynamic team focused on providing services to clients in multiple geographies.

Responsibilities

  • Responsible for processing import shipments
  • Forward Arrival Notices and communicate ETA with customers.
  • Distribute documentation, track movement of shipment from origin to destination.according to customer requirements. Issue delivery order to carrier, monitor timely delivery and obtain POD.
  • Set up trucking and coordinate all shipments with transportation providers
  • Issue delivery order to carrier, monitor timely deliver.
  • Maintain files. Enter file data. Update online system with applicable data elements. Bill for each file. Issue forms and documents. Compete filing as per departmental guidelines.
  • Communicate with overseas offices, agents, customers and domestic vendors.
  • Follow Standard Operating Procedures and operational strategies

Requirements Include

  • All-around knowledge of Import regulations
  • Excellent communications and customer service skills
  • Strong basic business relations skills
  • Minimum of 7 years of experience in the Global Forwarding Industry with at least 5 years of management experience
  • Excellent technology skills including Microsoft Applications (Strong Excel skills preferred)
  • Work effectively in a team environment. Must be a team player.

Excellent work environment, generous salary and bonus, Medical/Dental, 401K, Vacation Days, All National Holidays, PTO, etc.

location: Gardena, California

job type: Permanent

salary: $110,000 - 120,000 per year

work hours: 9 to 5

education: No Degree Required

experience: 7 Years

skills: Vendor Relations

Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.

At Randstad, we welcome people of all abilities and want to ensure that our hiring and interview process meets the needs of all applicants. If you require a reasonable accommodation to make your application or interview experience a great one, please contact HRsupport@randstadusa.com.

Pay offered to a successful candidate will be based on several factors including the candidate's education, work experience, work location, specific job duties, certifications, etc. In addition, Randstad offers a comprehensive benefits package, including health, an incentive and recognition program, and 401K contribution (all benefits are based on eligibility).

This posting is open for thirty (30) days.

Qualified applicants in San Francisco with criminal histories will be considered for employment in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

We will consider for employment all qualified Applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.
